title: Optimize AI agent setup for Beads workflow
description: Update agent prompts and documentation to use Beads as primary issue tracking system. Transition from markdown-first to Beads-first workflow while keeping markdown for detailed implementation plans. Update CLAUDE.md, agent prompts in .claude/, and any workflow documentation to reflect hybrid approach: Beads for tracking/status/dependencies, markdown for detailed architecture/implementation plans.

title: Update product-manager agent prompt for Beads
description: Update .claude/agents/product-manager.md to use 'bd list' commands instead of checking markdown files. Emphasize Beads-first workflow: check bd list --status open, create issues with bd create, update with bd update. Markdown files are for detailed implementation plans only.

title: Update issue-handler agent prompt for Beads
description: Update .claude/agents/issue-handler.md to create Beads issues for every GitHub issue using bd create with --external-ref 'gh:XXX'. Update workflow to use bd update for tracking reproduction and fixes. Remove references to creating markdown files for issues.

title: Update /task and /triage slash commands for Beads
description: Update .claude/commands/task.md and triage.md to create Beads issues instead of markdown files. Commands should use bd create for new tasks/issues and link to detailed markdown plans when needed.

title: Review and refine CLAUDE.md Beads integration
description: Review CLAUDE.md (already partially updated) to ensure all agent guidelines clearly emphasize Beads-first workflow. Add examples of common bd commands for each agent type. Ensure hybrid approach is clear: Beads for tracking, markdown for detailed plans.

title: Analyze EdgarTools project structure for optimization opportunities
description: Comprehensive analysis of EdgarTools project structure to identify optimization opportunities: (1) Documentation locations and purposes (docs/, docs-internal/, README.md, CLAUDE.md), (2) Git ignored locations (.git/info/exclude, .gitignore patterns), (3) Example code organization and discoverability, (4) Test directory structure and organization, (5) Agent configuration files (.claude/agents/, .claude/commands/), (6) Planning and tracking files (active-tasks/, features/, architecture/), (7) Redundancies or inconsistencies in structure. Deliverable: Analysis document with specific recommendations for improvements.

title: Consolidate examples structure to single directory
description:
Consolidate top-level directories to simplify project structure.

BEFORE:
- examples/ (8 scripts)
- notebooks/ (28 notebooks)
- gists/ (53 scripts, hidden)

AFTER:
- examples/
  - scripts/ (8 scripts: basic/, advanced/, ai/)
  - notebooks/ (28 notebooks: beginner/, xbrl/, filings/, funds/, insiders/)

Changes:
- Move notebooks/ → examples/notebooks/
- Move examples/{basic,advanced,ai}/ → examples/scripts/{basic,advanced,ai}/
- Move gists/ → docs-internal/gists/ (keep hidden)
- Update README files and documentation links
- Remove gists/ and scripts/ from .git/info/exclude

Impact: Single examples/ directory for all learning resources
Files changed: ~40 files renamed, 3 README files updated
notes: Consolidation complete - all files moved and documentation updated

title: AI-driven notebook validation and code updates
description:
AI-driven notebook validation and update task.

OBJECTIVE: Use AI agent to programmatically review, test, and rewrite all 28 notebooks to ensure they work correctly with current EdgarTools API.

AGENT APPROACH:
1. Read each notebook file (.ipynb JSON format)
2. Extract and analyze code cells
3. Identify issues:
   - Deprecated API usage
   - Import errors
   - Broken examples
   - Invalid company tickers/CIKs
   - API changes since notebook creation
4. Rewrite code cells to:
   - Use current EdgarTools API
   - Fix broken imports/examples
   - Update deprecated methods
   - Ensure code executes successfully
5. Update markdown cells if needed for accuracy
6. Write corrected notebook back to disk

NOTEBOOKS BY PRIORITY:
- beginner/ (3) - CRITICAL - notebooks/beginner/*.ipynb
- xbrl/ (18) - HIGH - notebooks/xbrl/*.ipynb  
- filings/ (3) - HIGH - notebooks/filings/*.ipynb
- funds/ (3) - MEDIUM - notebooks/funds/*.ipynb
- insiders/ (1) - MEDIUM - notebooks/insiders/*.ipynb
- other/ (1) - LOW - notebooks/other/*.ipynb

AGENT INSTRUCTIONS:
- For each notebook, test code execution mentally/logically
- Check against current EdgarTools API (edgar/__init__.py, CLAUDE.md)
- Rewrite code cells to fix issues
- Preserve educational value and explanations
- Update examples to use valid, current data
- Verify imports work with current package structure

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- All notebooks use current API (no deprecated methods)
- Code examples are valid and would execute successfully  
- Imports match current package structure
- Examples use accessible companies/filings
- Educational content remains clear and accurate

EXECUTION:
Use test-specialist or docs-writer agent to:
1. Iterate through notebook directories by priority
2. Read, analyze, and rewrite each notebook
3. Test logic and API compatibility
4. Save updated notebooks
5. Report issues found and fixes applied
notes: ✅ VALIDATION COMPLETE - All 28 notebooks are fully compatible with current EdgarTools API. No updates required. Created validation report at notebooks/VALIDATION_REPORT.md and validation script at scripts/validate_notebooks.py. All beginner, XBRL, filings, funds, insiders, and other notebooks use current API patterns correctly. Automated validator created for ongoing maintenance.

title: Test issue for verification
description: This is a test issue to verify Beads is working correctly

title: Beads Migration Complete - Phase 1
description: Successfully migrated EdgarTools to Beads issue tracking system. Completed: installation, initialization, helper scripts, agent documentation.

title: Implement project structure optimizations
description: Implement the optimizations identified in the project structure analysis (edgartools-adz). This includes: reorganizing documentation for better discoverability, optimizing git ignore patterns, improving example code organization, refining test directory structure, consolidating redundant files, and implementing any other recommended improvements from the analysis. Must wait for analysis to complete before starting implementation.
notes:
Project structure optimizations completed:

CRITICAL: Made 61 files discoverable (28 notebooks + 8 scripts)
- Organized notebooks by topic: beginner/, xbrl/, filings/, funds/, insiders/, other/
- Organized examples by difficulty: basic/, advanced/, ai/
- Created README files for navigation
- Updated docs/examples.md with links

HIGH: Consolidated legacy directories
- Moved internal/ → docs-internal/legacy/internal/
- Standardized: active-tasks→active, completed/*, archived/*

MEDIUM: Tracked .claude/ in git
- 14 agent prompts + 8 commands now version controlled
- Created .claude/README.md

Impact: Users can now discover examples on GitHub, docs can link to examples
Files changed: 63 files staged
